instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 01700 no backlight
threads.message:
Hello

I've got <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2019 16 inch macbook pro touch bar, 01700.
Liquid damaged. backlight was shorted on the connector, I replaced following:
- display connectors and flex
- burned components and a connector around touchbar area
- mux chip
- display tcon board(corrosion)
Laptop boots normally, I have image but no backlight. 0V on the backlight line when laptop is powered on and booting normally, theres image but no backlight.

I assumed that the screen itself has backlight working fine because when I connect it to the external display and start recovery the laptop screen has good and even backlight, but no image.

Question is - how do I diagnose the backlight controller chip? Its very difficult to measure anything backlight related when the mainboard is in the chasis, otherwise it won't start.
So I cannot check the backlight enable pins for signal because its located on the other side of the board.

I'm trying to check chips <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> and <CHIP>U9801</CHIP>. 

Or if you can point me in the right direction if I'm completely wrong about it, that would be amazing.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 01700 no backlight
threads.message: I recommend to test with known good working LCD assembly.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 01700 no backlight
threads.message:
I'm afraid that's out of the question. I can't really spend 600-700$ on a screen then have it lying around without any use.
What I'd like to know - is there any way I can check these two IC's if theyre damaged? 
<CHIP>U9801</CHIP> has connection to the mux chip, so if the mux got burned so could the <CHIP>U9801</CHIP>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 01700 no backlight
threads.message:
You've said to get backlight at some moment, so I doubt to be a problem with backlight circuits.

<CHIP>U9801</CHIP> has internal firmware, may need donor board, same model (not sure however).

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 01700 no backlight
threads.message:
Yes that’s correct, but that backlight was switching on when using external display. 
The way I understand this:
- even without good or properly soldered mux chip I had display on external 
- mux chip has connections to the backlight controller and <CHIP>U9801</CHIP>
- I have assumed it might be one of those chips or something else that is bad

I would love to be able to go through all this myself but I’m not able to power on the board outside the chassis to have a look at the side where the chips I mentioned are located

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 01700 no backlight
threads.message:
The board should start automatically, when the charger is connected.
You just need to connect an USB port and LCD video cable; not easy however.
Board will not work properly (missing trackpad thermal sensors), but should serve for test.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 01700 no backlight
threads.message:
Well I have only managed to see a proper boot then it has all connectors plugged in, but it still required some acrobatics to even try to measure anything.

I assume working board doesn’t turn on the backlight when it’s not booting properly, am I correct?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 01700 no backlight
threads.message:
Backlight should appear, even only LCD and charger connected.
Possibly flexgate problem and need good LCD assembly to discard this problem.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 01700 no backlight
threads.message: Alright, I understand now. Thank for explaining this to me. Thank you for the the help and your time.
